review_title: Quality Outpatient Department with Supportive Team Environment
pros: As a clinician on the OUTPATIENT team, I worked with some of the most talented, compassionate, and knowledgeable people I've ever known, many of whom have become close friends and trusted peers in the field. The now-director of the program works tirelessly to make sure that quality care and safety is provided to patients and that her staff feel supported. It was often an incredibly fast-paced work environment, which meant I learned a lot during the time I was there. If you're considering applying to Westborough Behavioral, I would strongly recommend the outpatient department over the rest of the hospital. Being its own program, it's more insulated from the rest of the dynamics in the hospital. Compensation and benefits were a bit higher than many other organizations I've looked into.
cons: I truthfully don't have constructive or favorable things to say about the company and experience overall, but instead of focusing on the negatives I encountered, I'm choosing to focus on highlighting the positives of the outpatient program specifically.

review_title: BEWARE! LISTEN TO THE REVIEWS! DON’T WASTE YOUR TIME APPLYING
pros: I would say nothing is worth all the aggravation and unsafe practices.
cons:
I was so happy when I got the call to be hired but I knew once I went to orentation only have 2 weeks of orentation for nurses and 1 week for MHTs was going to be a disaster. I understood this was a startup company, but they have been opened for over a year and they STILL have the same issues. 

For instance, SAFETY. They understaff so badly that people have gotten hurt and they don’t care. They follow a “grid” and that “grid” is terribly dangerous to you the worker and the other patients. There were times when MHTs would be by themselves with a violent patient and got hit and since it was in an area where there happened to be no cameras the patient was always correct and the staff would be told to “get a lawyer”... Seriously! Its terrible. 

MANAGEMENT: You NEVER saw them on the floor and if you did they would either be yelling at you or going against policy and letting the patients do whatever. It was terrible, no one is on the same page there.

COMMUNICATION: TERRBILE! There isn’t one!!! They say they care in orentation but I was there for a couple of months and it was the same issues, and they would focus on the tinyest things instead of the bigger issues.

STAFFING: So many people call out ALL THE TIME! Leaving you with NO STAFF! So now its severely understaffed and dangerous! WHen you needed a manager NO ONE WOULD COME! They used supervisors BUT sometimes even they weren’t there! 

STRUCTURE: There wasnt any. On the weekends it was a free for all for the patients. No therapists, doctors, social workers come in on weekends so nurses and MHT’s were left to do groups and the rest of the day free. It was terrible, then since they were ALWAYS short staffed patients couldn’t go down to the gym or whatnot because it wasn’t safe! 

SECURITY: There is NO security durning the day. Only 3-11 & 11-7a. BUT, they make them as MHT’s and sit on 1:1 so if something is happening they cant do anything. So unsafe! They figure durning the day they have enough “upper managerment” who are USELESS and just STARE and watch! None of them would restrain a patient in high heels and suits!

BUILDING: Its falling apart! Housekeeping is a joke! There only there during the week, 7-3 and its 1 or 2 people! The place is gross and filthy! They hardly clean the adolescent unit because there so scared to be over there and when asked they say there too busy because they have the whole place to clean. So what does that come down to MONEY!

MONEY: This place is ALL ABOUT MAKING MONEY! They do NOT care about the patients. These patients are so acute and you need proper staff to help them and its not far for 1 person to set the whole milieu off because you cant have any “extra” person to help de-escalate. 

CODES: Tons of restraint codes. Espically on Adolescent Unit. They understaff this unit a lot, so you can’t properly keep them entertained. That’s also where structure comes in, not enough structure to keep them busy.

ENVIRONMENT: HOSTILE! As soon as I stepped onto the floor, nurses, MHT’s, therapists, were so upset and angry! Angry because of all these issues that have been brought to management and done nothing about it. I have seen MHT’s and nurses walk out because they are in fear or their license and TRUST ME this place could careless about your license or safety! 

PAY: Yes they do pay good BUT is it really worth all the hassle, unsafe practices, and losing your licenses for a company would could care less about you and the patients in the end. People call out ALL the time and now your stuck doing checks all night even though you shouldn’t be but what are they going to do?!

INTAKE: They DO NOT screen patients! Meaning that these can be ex felons, sex offenders, rap sheets a mile long and the staff is not properly trained to handle that nor the staffing ratio is so bad it’s very unsafe.

Overall: people are tired there, the staff that are good and come in are overworked and tired and end up leaving because of the practices. There is a HIGH turnover rate. You will find very few nurses and MHT’s that were there when the place opened after that the place is running on new people. They are hiring and doing orentation every 2 weeks and some people leave right away because they see and hear what is going on. Its sad. The idea of helping patients is there BUT it all boils down to TERRIBLE management and making money! 

My advice, dont waste your time.

job_title: Mental Health Technician in Westborough, MA
pros: The MHTs, RNs, clinicians, and medical staff are all amazing and hardworking. They truly care about the patients and are very dedicated.
cons: The management is terrible (minus Sheila). Communication is poor. They focus on making completely useless and unnecessary changes while ignoring the major issues. After being with WBHH for some time now, I was hoping it would get better because I think this place has a lot of potential, however this has not been the case. They are understaffed yet send people home to fit an arbitrary grid system that leaves MHTs alone on units at times dealing with 12+ patients. I have been scared for my life and the lives of patients and my coworkers too many times to count due to management’s inability to schedule and staff units. All they care about is opening new units to fill beds and make more money, even though they don’t have enough staff to function with the already present units. Employee turnover is as high as I’ve ever seen it at a company due to these issues. About half of the orientation groups quit their first day on the units, and the ones who stay quit one or two weeks later. Since I started working here, I would say 50% of the staff I originally started with have left.
